A great drought is sweeping through eastern Abyssinia. With the economy already weakened by the decline of the DPAEB, we are facing mass starvation as crops fail.

The newly-privatized DPAEB in eastern Ethiopia has announced a plan to expand towards Mogadishu, in the Indian Ocean coast. As the European engineers started surveying the countryside in search for the optimum route, they came into contact with the traditional nobility of the area. Upon hearing that their traditional grazing lands would be the site of major construction works, the herders protested to the government.
Ignore their protests, let the DPAEB expand

The Addis Abeba-Mogadishu railroad was bound to create trouble. Concerned about the railroad being drawn across their land, the nobility in eastern Ethiopia have ordered the cattle herders to begin attacking the workers. The private consortium has brought in guards, and have killed a number of herders. Swift action is required unless this is going to escalate even further.
Take the side of the private consortium
Take the side of the herders and local nobility
A number of local nobles in the eastern highlands have raised militias to attack the works of the DPAEB!

Our emperor Haile Selassie is known to have abitions of modernization for the country. This includes not only plans to build new factories and infrastructure and modernize our army, but also several legal and institutional reforms to improve the quality of life for our people. However, the broadening of these reforms will mean an end to many priviledges of the Orthodox Church and the nobility, which will attract much resistance from the conservative circles.
Ignore their protests, start the reforms
We value our traditions, forget about these reforms

As the imperial government has announced its intention of starting a number of modernizing reforms, the conservative politicians and the nobility has expressed their discontent, fearing this will incur in a loss of influence for them.
The princes be damned, the reforms will continue
Appease the nobility by granting them more power
As the emperor has decided to work together with the nobles, the question arose as to how much power would be given to their hands...
Give them some important civil and military offices
The nobles serve their country best in the military
Give them control over the civil offices

Having secured control over several vital government offices, the nobility has begun pressing for the discontinuation of most of the liberal reforms of Haile Selassie I. If the negus negast descides to continue the reforms, they might use their power against him.
The nobles be damned, the reforms will continue

Faced with the stubborn refusal of Haile Selassie I to end his reforms, several of the aristocrats and conservative politicians have ordered their militias to take up arms against the emperor, most notably in the disgruntled eastern provinces.
Elements within our army have switched allegiance to the rebellious lords!

The rebelling princes and their militias have control over the Ethiopian capital of Addis Abeba. We must now select a new negus negast, to be appointed from among the princes. Chief contestants are the prince of all Tigray, Ras Seyom Mengesha and Dejazmatch Haile Selassie Gugsa, great-grandson of Yohannes IV -
